item.title: Lock please
item.dc:creator: @jinglesassy jinglesassy
item.description:
@jinglesassy wrote:

this is mine:

if(command.startsWith(“ipban”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“put your name here”)) {
String otherPName = command.substring(6);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);
if(otherPIndex != -1 && server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex] != null)
{
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
PlayerHandler.kickNick = otherPName;
sendMessage(p.connectedFrom+" is now banned.");
BufferedWriter bw = null;

try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“data/bannedips.txt”, true));
bw.write(p.connectedFrom);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error banning ip.”);
}
}
}
}

and in put your name here put the name u want to be able to ip ban on in it then compile it

Read full topic

item.title: Lock please
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:
@warlock_999 wrote:

ok i was trying to add ip ban in [code]if(command.startsWith(“ipban”) && (playerRights >= 3))
{
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];
appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
v.disconnected = true;
sendMessage(“player successfully ip banned”);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));

bw.write(playerName+" banned"+victim);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
v.disconnected = true;
sendMessage(“Error logging ip bans!”);
}
}[/code] this is the error i got [code]client.java:10308: illegal start of expression
public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
^
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .
